Issues.Title: updated notification javascript guidelines
Issues.Body:
This is a **documentation fix**.

### Proposed solution

The 'notification' component JavaScript Example does not work when there are multiple notifications present within a page as the $notification variable is not scoped. This allows the closing of one notification, and all the subsequent ones do not close as the $notification.parentNode reference no longer exists.
This can be solved by adding a simple var statement in front of the $notification variable. Such a solution would have saved me a lot of time (and many unsuspecting future users) as it is not trivially identified, hence making it significantly easier to use this component.

### Testing Done

None.

### Changelog updated?

No.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "updated notification javascript guidelines" (#3132)

Issues.Title: Question: Negative Margin in Titles?
Issues.Body:
This is about Bulma

I have a question

### Overview of the problem

It turns out that Bulma uses negative margins in at least two places, namely the title and subtitle classes that are not also "is-spaced"

Negative margins raise all sorts of alarm bells in my head, as I learned that the only time to use them is if you want to overlap a div with a previous div - which I doubt is the goal when using titles and subtitles?

I know I can just override the variable, but why was this choice made, and is there no better solution? 

We stumbled across this when adjusting the header sizes in our derived theme, and were wondering about this when our headers suddenly started overlapping.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Question: Negative Margin in Titles?" (#3123)

Issues.Title: add variables to configure the darken and lighten amounts
Issues.Body:
This is an improvement. I wanted to be able to make the hover and active colors of Bulma buttons a darker shade. I found that this is done with a 2.5% and 5% static value, so I made them configurable variables like almost everything else in Bulma. I did a search through the code and found a few more of these static percentages, along with a few 10% values, so I created initial variables to cover all of these values.

### Proposed solution

Solution is to create and use variables to make the darken and lighten amounts used in Bulma configurable.

### Tradeoffs

I really can't think of any tradeoffs here. The only other alternative is to overwrite some SASS in the project that is using Bulma, but I feel like this is supposed to be in the Bulma code base.

### Testing Done

I started from the main (master) branch, ran `npm install` and `npm run build` to make sure it builds normally. I also tested the values in my project to make sure they worked as initial values and when configured to a different value.


### Changelog updated?

No - I was not sure how to add content to changelog without it being in a new version section. But it would be like this:

### New features

* New variables `$darken-half`, `$darken-full`, `$darken-double`, `$lighten-full`, `$lighten-double`, `$button-darken-half`, `$button-darken-full`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "add variables to configure the darken and lighten amounts" (#3118)

Issues.Title: Why box-sizing attribute not typed for column class?
Issues.Body:
When I import columns grid in my project, i got a problem with columns sizes (columns are larger or smaller than they should be).

I found that problem appeared because .column class dont have box-sizing attribute. So grid works well only if I import reset css file (bulma\sass\base\minireset.sass), where i found this code:

```
// Box sizing
html
  box-sizing: border-box

*
  &,
  &::before,
  &::after
    box-sizing: inherit
```

Without this code grid dont works well. 

So I suggest to add in .column class box-sizing:border-box attribute for those users who dont need import all Bulma framework in his project.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Why box-sizing attribute not typed for column class?" (#3113)

Issues.Title: Update changelog with correct SASS to rollback 0.8.0 button change
Issues.Body:
This is about the Docs.

### Overview of the problem

The SASS code in the changelog to rollback the form control size is impossible to include in a webpack project without modifying the bulma source code

This is about the Bulma **Docs**
I'm using Bulma **version** [0.9.0]
This is a **Sass** issue: I'm using version 1.26.10

### Steps to Reproduce

Paste the [changelog code](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#larger-form-controls):

``` sass
$control-height: 2.25em
$control-padding-vertical: calc(0.375em - #{$control-border-width})
$control-padding-horizontal: calc(0.625em - #{$control-border-width})
$button-padding-vertical: calc(0.375em - #{$button-border-width})
$button-padding-horizontal: 0.75em
```

at any point in the include pipeline

### Expected behavior

No issues

### Actual behavior

If the code is pasted before including button.sass

```
$control-padding-vertical: calc(0.375em - #{$control-border-width});
                                                                       ^
Undefined variable: "$control-border-width".
```

If it's pasted after including button.sass, it has no effect

### Solution

This is the code I had to use to not refer to any variable yet undeclared, added before including bulma:

``` sass
$control-border-width: 1px !default
$control-height: 2.25em
$control-padding-vertical: calc(0.375em - #{$control-border-width})
$control-padding-horizontal: calc(0.625em - #{$control-border-width})
$button-padding-vertical: calc(0.375em - #{$control-border-width})
$button-padding-horizontal: 0.75em
```

Issues.Title: Fix z-index of disabled input/select
Issues.Body:
This is a **bugfix**. ### Example A disabled input/select has no border, so it overlaps the border of neighbouring fields, buttons and selects, thus breaking the expected style. ![disable input overlap](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6161739/92379905-857fd080-f108-11ea-9f4f-52f0859e8a9e.PNG) ```html

€

``` ### Proposed solution Inputs, buttons and selects in a grouped field should have a base z-index of 1 and disabled inputs/select 0, so disabled inputs/selects which are borderless, don't overlap the border of neighbouring fields, buttons and selects anymore. ![fixed z-index input and select](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6161739/92382542-0d67d980-f10d-11ea-85e1-487dbee12dd2.PNG) ### Tradeoffs None ### Testing Done Works fine for various combinations of combined inputs, buttons and selects ### Changelog updated? No.
